text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
Be careful how you are talking to yourself because you are listening.
Focus is the art of knowing what to ignore.
A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
We grow fearless when we do the things we fear.
If you find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn't lead anywhere.
Don't postpone joy until you have learned all of your lessons. Joy is your lesson.
Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity.
The only way you are going to have success is to have lots of failures first.
Pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can't take their eyes off of you.
Until you cross the bridge of your insecurities, you can't begin to explore your possibilities.
What you do every day matters more than what you do once in a while.
The death of a dream is the day that you stop believing in the work it takes to get there.
Imagine how you want to feel at the end of the day. Start working towards that now.
The secret to your success is found in your daily routine.
Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
Never overlook the power of simplicity.
What you do today is important because you are exchanging a day of your life for it.
A hero is one who knows how to hang on for one minute longer.
A year from now you will wish you had started today.
I have a gorgeous work ethic.
I am capable of learning and growing every day.
I attract positivity and abundance into my life.
I am in control of my mindset and choose to think positively.
I embrace challenges as opportunities for growth.
My potential is limitless and I am worthy of success.
I am grateful for the lessons life presents me.
I trust in my ability to overcome obstacles.
I am constantly evolving into the best version of myself.
I radiate confidence, self-assurance, and inner peace.
A wet person does not fear the rain.
When you have confidence, you can have a lot of fun. And when you have fun, you can do amazing things.
Optimism is a happiness magnet. If you stay positive, good things and good people will be drawn to you.
If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced.
If you want to look good in front of thousands, you have to outwork thousands in front of nobody.
It is our attitude at the beginning of a difficult task which, more than anything else, will affect its successful outcome.
It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
Inaction breeds doubt and fear. Action breeds confidence and courage.
Daily ripples of excellence over time become a tsunami of success.
It's a job that's never started that takes the longest to finish.
Whatever you hold in your mind on a consistent basis is exactly what you will experience in your life.
Give yourself permission to slow down. You can speed up by slowing down.
Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of others, instead, seek what they sought.
Winning starts with beginning.
As you start to walk out on the way, the way appears.
What would you attempt to do if you knew you could not fail?
If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
Courage doesn't always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day whispering, 'I will try again tomorrow.'
You don't learn to walk by following rules. You learn by doing, and by falling over.
The only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle.
Reflect upon your blessings, of which everyone has plenty, not on your past misfortunes, of which everyone has some.
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
There's power in looking silly and not caring that you do.
You have to expect things of yourself before you can do them.
Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
In any given moment we have two options: to step forward into growth or back into safety.
Nothing is so fatiguing as the eternal hanging on of an uncompleted task.
The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the face.
Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
Life is a series of building, testing, changing and iterating.
Feelings are just visitors. Let them come and go.
Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something.
Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.
I can accept failure. Everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.
To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream, not only plan, but also believe.
Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves strong. The amount of work is the same.
It is not the load that breaks you down. It's the way you carry it.
Outer order contributes to inner calm.
Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time.
When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
Time goes on. So whatever you're going to do, do it. Do it now. Don't wait.
Mistakes are the portals of discovery.
How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
Sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.
When you're curious, you find lots of interesting things to do.
It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Action expresses priorities.
Don't stumble over something behind you.
Most people quit because they look how far they have to go, not how far they have come.
There is real magic in enthusiasm. It spells the difference between mediocrity and accomplishment.
More people would learn from their mistakes if they weren't so busy denying them.
Just when you think it can't get any worse, it can. And just when you think it can't get any better, it can.
If I quit now, I will soon be back to where I started. And when I started I was desperately wishing to be where I am now.
Incredible things can be done simply if we are committed to making them happen.
Whatever your goal in life, unless you develop a great urgency, what could be near will be far away.
Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.
A key to success is to start before you are ready.
People who are unable to motivate themselves must be content with mediocrity no matter how impressive their other talents.
Enthusiasm is the great hill-climber.
Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't.
Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.
When you have exhausted all possibilities, remember this: you haven't.
If you're not making mistakes, then you're not making decisions.
If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
There is virtue in work and there is virtue in rest. Use both and overlook neither.
Though you cannot go back and start again, you can start from now and have a brand new end.
It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
The world moves so fast now that the person who says it can't be done is generally interrupted by someone doing it.
You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
Forget about all the reasons why something may not work. You only need to find one good reason why it will.
The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
Courage is like a muscle. We strengthen it by use.
When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow. It only saps today of its joy.
The brain is like a muscle. When it is in use we feel very good. Understanding is joyous.
Accept life as it is. Then work to make it the way you want it to be.
The secret of change is to focus all of your energy, not on fighting the old but on building the new.
The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existence.
Learning is a weightless treasure you can always carry easily.
Somewhere, something incredible is waiting to be known.
Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
What one has to do usually can be done.
Success hinges less on getting everything right than on how you handle getting things wrong.
This is the real secret to life—to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
The important thing about a problem is not its solution, but the strength we gain in finding the solution.
Try and fail, but don't fail to try.
Do fewer things. Do them better. Know why you're doing them.
Creativity is intelligence having fun.
Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.
Change is the end result of all true learning.
Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
Intelligence is the ability to avoid doing work, yet getting the work done.

I'm perfectly happy with all the people who are walking around and just staring at the clouds and looking at the stars and saying, "I want to go there." But I'm looking at the ground, and I want to fix the pothole that's right in front of me before I fall in.
Bad programmers worry about the code. Good programmers worry about data structures and their relationships.
Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
If you need more than 3 levels of indentation, you're screwed anyway, and should fix your program.
Avoiding complexity reduces bugs.
Those that can, do. Those that can't, complain.
People who are doing things for fun do things the right way by themselves.
Any program is only as good as it is useful.
Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
I am a skilled and capable coder.
I embrace challenges in coding as opportunities for growth.
I am continuously improving my programming skills.
I enjoy the process of problem-solving in software development.
I am confident in my ability to understand complex algorithms.
I am capable of building innovative and impactful software solutions.
I am proficient in multiple programming languages.
I am resourceful and creative in finding solutions to coding problems.
I am patient and persistent when debugging code.
I am a valuable member of any software development team.
I am open to feedback and always seek to improve my code.
I am passionate about writing clean and efficient code.
I am focused and productive when working on coding projects.
I am adaptable and able to quickly learn new technologies.
I am confident in my ability to tackle any coding challenge.
I am proud of the projects I have created through programming.
I am a master of algorithms and data structures.
I am grateful for the opportunities coding brings to my life.
I let go of perfectionism and embrace progress over perfection.
I trust in the timing of my journey and remain patient and persistent.
I celebrate my progress and enjoy the journey of achieving my goals.
I set clear and achievable goals for myself and pursue them with vigour.
I am mindfully present in each moment, savouring the journey as much as the destination.
I am proactive and seize every opportunity to carve out the life I desire.
I am resilient and bounce back from setbacks with unwavering determination.
I break down my goals into manageable steps and take decisive action.
I remain steadfastly focused and unfailingly motivated, even in the face of challenges.
I am disciplined and unwaveringly committed to following through on my plans.
I liberate myself from the shackles of perfectionism and wholeheartedly embrace progress over perfection.
I infuse my life with laughter and delight, embracing every moment with a sense of fun.
I am astute and quick-witted, effortlessly navigating life's challenges with intelligence.
I have an insatiable thirst for knowledge and a sharp intellect that fuels my success.
I cultivate a playful spirit, seeing the world through the eyes of curiosity and wonder.
I am resourceful and adaptable, able to turn any situation into an opportunity for enjoyment.
I cherish my inner child and allow myself to indulge in moments of pure, unbridled fun.
I am a beacon of positivity and light, spreading joy wherever I go.
I approach challenges with a sense of humour, seeing setbacks as opportunities for growth.
I embrace my uniqueness and express myself authentically, finding joy in my individuality.
I am open-minded and receptive to new experiences, allowing life to surprise and delight me.
I trust in my ability to make smart decisions.
I radiate intelligence and wisdom, earning the respect and admiration of those around me.
I am wise beyond my years, capable of making sound decisions that lead to success.
I am resourceful and adaptable, finding creative solutions to any problem.
Always leave the code better than you found it.
Less code, fewer bugs.
Plan for failure, design for success.
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
Programming is the art of doing one thing at a time.
Make it correct, make it clear, make it concise, make it fast. In that order.
Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad
It seems that perfection is attained not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing more to remove.
I honour the principle of you aren't gonna need it (YAGNI), resisting the temptation to over-engineer solutions and focusing only on the features needed at present.
I embrace the principle of keeping it simple, stupid (KISS), ensuring that my code is straightforward and easy to understand.
I embody the principle of don't repeat yourself (DRY), striving to eliminate redundancy and maintain a single source of truth in my codebase.
I remain focused on delivering value to users without adding unnecessary features.
I modularize my codebase to promote reusability and maintainability.
I trust in the power of simplicity to create robust and maintainable software solutions.
I trust in the wisdom of YAGNI, focusing only on what is essential for the task at hand.
Every line of code is a step forward on the path to mastery.
Build your codebase like a fortress, sturdy and resilient against the winds of change.
Code with conviction, knowing that every keystroke shapes the future of technology.
Focus not only on writing code but also on understanding the problem.
Document your code not just for others but also for your future self.
Embrace the iterative nature of software development; each iteration brings improvement.
Code with empathy, considering the experience of those who will interact with it.
Take breaks to recharge your mind; productivity flourishes in moments of rest.
Code review is not just about finding errors; it's an opportunity for collaboration and growth.
I approach code reviews with an open mind, eager to learn from the insights of my peers.
I gracefully accept feedback on my code, recognizing that it contributes to the overall quality of our project.
I appreciate the insights gained through pair programming, recognizing that two minds are better than one.
I actively engage in code reviews, recognizing the value of collective code ownership in our team.
I approach code reviews with a spirit of collaboration, understanding that we are all working towards a common goal.
I choose to see constructive criticism as an opportunity for improvement, rather than a personal attack.
I choose to view feedback on my code as an invitation to evolve and improve, rather than a criticism of my abilities.
I delight in the endless array of tools and technologies at my disposal.
Lower the cost of failure.
Deciding what not to do is as important as deciding what to do.
